subject: Re: [junit] Code Reuse and Modify
msgSnippet: JUnit source is released under the CPL.  The FAQ and source forge differ on the licensing version though... -
messageBody:
JUnit source is released under the CPL. The FAQ and source forge differ on
the licensing version though...

- http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#overview_7 -- says version
0.5
- http://sourceforge.net/projects/junit/develop -- says version 1.0

The CPL is described here --
http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/library/os-cplfaq.html

Personally I think this information should appear in the source code files,
not the whole license, but some sort of copyright. But maybe that is not
the author's intent.

If you'd like to develop with/on the code you can obtain the latest source
from http://github.com/KentBeck/junit.

Hope I helped,

Big Mike

P.S. There is more information on the FAQ --
http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm

On Thu, Mar 11, 2010 at 5:40 AM, Prajwal <prajwalkr@...> wrote:

>
>
> Can i reuse the code which is provided by junit.jar.
> if so, can i modify the code according to my need.
> if possible how can i do it.
>
> Please can any one help me in this regard?
>
>
>
